title: Why this CEO refuses to get up at dawn
text:
Incitec Pivot CEO Jeanne Johns admits she is not a morning person, and reckons the competition between CEOs on how much they can do before 8am is “ridiculous”.

“CEOs seem to compete saying, ‘I get up at 5am and run my five miles and I’ve done all this work’,” says Johns, who prefers to “ease into” her mornings.

Incitec Pivot chief Jeanne Johns believes a CEO’s judgment is more important than the hours spent churning out emails. Arsineh Houspian

“It’s funny, once you start a competition about how early you get up and how many things you get done in the morning, everyone says that must be the game we are in.

"That’s what we end up trying to prove – who can get more done before 8am.”

The head of the listed chemicals, explosives and fertiliser maker says a CEO’s judgment is more important than the hours spent churning out emails.
description: Incitec Pivot chief Jeanne Johns has no time for the competition between CEOs to do as much work as possible before 8am.
